body: I think the title still not for search friendly, can you change it again?

@duanbin0414, Thanks for your discuss and article.

In fact, problem for routing to additional nodes when the database and table sharding column are the same one, community has been known, you can search more issues about this problem like #2193 .

We design current routeEngine to calculate database sharding columns and table sharding columns independent. Because the shardingRule are different for each user.
The design can only call one time database sharding algorithm and table sharding algorithm. And users can think about and configure database sharding algorithm and table sharding algorithm independent. Especially in different database and table sharding column.

In your article, I see a base solution, but this solution only can solve the situation that sharding columns are same one and the numbers of database and table are equals. I think it is very customized. Do you have a more complete solution?

We can discuss in this issue.

Do you use 4.0.0-RC2 release version?

I think the problem is reference #2613 . Should be fixed in 4.0.0-RC2 release.

> Can you provide your sharding rule configuration?

I didn't describe it clearly, Now I think I'm clear. I'm sorry.
```java
 @Column(name = "USER_ID")
private Long userId;
```
```xml
spring.shardingsphere.sharding.tables.my_friend.table-strategy.inline.sharding-column=USER_ID
spring.shardingsphere.sharding.tables.my_friend.table-strategy.inline.algorithm-expression=my_friend_$->{USER_ID % 10}
```
Looks ok, but error:
`java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke method mod() on null object`

Now let's change that:
```xml
spring.shardingsphere.sharding.tables.my_friend.table-strategy.inline.sharding-column=USER_ID
spring.shardingsphere.sharding.tables.my_friend.table-strategy.inline.algorithm-expression=my_friend_$->{user_id % 10}
```
run well.

The issues is simply that inline.algorithm-expression don't support uppercase.

It's a minor problem, It just doesn't look consistent.

I have solved the problem,but new problem happend.
[config-sharding.txt](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/files/3834206/config-sharding.txt)
[server.txt](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/files/3834207/server.txt)
`

version is  4.0.0-RC2
I introduced the following Maven configuration according to the official documents

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.shardingsphere</groupId>
            <artifactId>sharding-jdbc-spring-boot-starter</artifactId>
            <version>4.0.0-RC2</version>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.shardingsphere</groupId>
            <artifactId>sharding-jdbc-spring-namespace</artifactId>
            <version>4.0.0-RC2</version>
        </dependency>
I use the range fragmentation algorithm instead of the composite fragmentation algorithm

@lyricsqq Can you provide your full sharding configuration, or push your demo code to GitHub?

Can help us to locate the problem.

The exception occurs in the method of the following screenshot of the parsingsqlrouter class. And I looked at the 4.0.0-rc3 code, and I think this problem should still exist
![Uploading image.png…]()

The configuration file and implementation class are as follows. Because the attachment does not support suffix, I will change the file suffix to txtl
[application-test.txt](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/files/3834658/application-test.txt)

[Range.txt](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/files/3834662/Range.txt)

> @duanbin0414, Thanks for your discuss and article.
> 
> In fact, problem for routing to additional nodes when the database and table sharding column are the same one, community has been known, you can search more issues about this problem like #2193 .
> 
> We design current routeEngine to calculate database sharding columns and table sharding columns independent. Because the shardingRule are different for each user.
> The design can only call one time database sharding algorithm and table sharding algorithm. And users can think about and configure database sharding algorithm and table sharding algorithm independent. Especially in different database and table sharding column.
> 
> In your article, I see a base solution, but this solution only can solve the situation that sharding columns are same one and the numbers of database and table are equals. I think it is very customized. Do you have a more complete solution?
> 
> We can discuss in this issue.

First, I do assume that there are the same number of tables in each database. I refer to the official configuration example and think it is consistent with the official one.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50389867/68646398-07898200-0556-11ea-9376-7b91e6f3b12c.png)

Although the actual name of the table in my database is different. For example: ds0:user0,user1. ds1:user2,user3. Although loading the configured data node is inconsistent with the actual situation, it does not affect the correctness of my data routing. Because through my custom database and table algorithm I will not route to a nonexistent node. For example: ds0:user2,user3, but according to the existing official logic these errors will occur.

According to my understanding, whether the key of database and database table is the same or not is only related to the specific table and database sorting algorithm, so it will not affect my routing logic.

According to my understanding, the most likely problem between the official configuration and me is that if multiple data are configured, but only part of a table is designed, it needs to be configured in order.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50389867/68646797-1f153a80-0557-11ea-897a-2c401493c08a.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50389867/68646833-3bb17280-0557-11ea-8e84-fa860d98fbae.png)
databases configuration order needs to be adjusted on its own.or combine by multiple $->{ expression }.

Welcome to point out mistakes.
I don't know how to get the demo on github running for you.Can I give you a link to my demo warehouse

> What is your ShradingSphere's version?

my version is 3.1.0

##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)

> First, I do assume that there are the same number of tables in each database. I refer to the official configuration example and think it is consistent with the official one.

Sorry, I means your solution only support the database route result number equals to table route result. If the results are not equals, there are some result will be dropped.
BTW, `ds${0..1}.t_order_item${0..1}` is 2 databases and 4 tables(2 tables in each database).

> but according to the existing official logic these errors will occur.

The problem has been fixed in 4.0.0-RC3 which has been in release vote step, detail in #2193.

> According to my understanding, whether the key of database and database table is the same or not is only related to the specific table and database sorting algorithm, so it will not affect my routing logic.

Sorry, I think it has some different in same sharding column and different columns.
Because different sharding columns means the two algorithm are independent fully, but for same sharding column, they may has some related in database and table.

> it needs to be configured in order. databases configuration order needs to be adjusted on its own.or combine by multiple $->{ expression }.

I don't get why users need to configure databases and tables by order except binding-table.

At last, I suggest you put a more detail and complete design, current information is too dispersed to  understand. I only can get one custom fix -- try route with your logic, if result database and table numbers are equal, then return, otherwise use origin route?

> I don't know how to get the demo on github running for you.Can I give you a link to my demo warehouse

create repo in your GitHub. and push your demo code to the repo you create. Then copy the link to these. the demo code should be simple and can reproduce the problem.

your configuration may be enough, If you can provide your SQL will help us more.

Later, I will create a demo to reproduce the problems I encountered in the project, which may take several hours. I will provide a code that fully replicates the problem you can run directly But my comment is Chinese because I am not good at English in China If the code needs to provide English comments, you can let me know

> Please add test case

I've added test cases, but I‘m not sure if I haven't noticed anything

> Later, I will create a demo to reproduce the problems I encountered in the project, which may take several hours. I will provide a code that fully replicates the problem you can run directly But my comment is Chinese because I am not good at English in China If the code needs to provide English comments, you can let me know

Thanks, English comments will be better. you can provide your SQL first, if we can't reproduce your problem, we will need your demo code later.

https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/650

Hi,  I found the root cause of NullPointerException is:
The SQL is routed to default data source but didn't check whether the default data source exists, so the dataSourceName in RoutingUnit in null. 
For this scene, I submitted a PR, please take a review,  thank you.

I changed the code and it worked The start time and end time need to be more than 2 months before the error effect can be seen。
eg：

startTime = 2019-01-01
endTime = 2019-04-05
Please remove the code at the pull, thank you. It will work

@59471032  I'll try with your configuration file.

> > 4.0.0-RC2 I meet the same problem，Normal after removing druid
> > 我用的是hicari，没有用druid一样的是这个问题。请问你现在用的是哪个数据有组件

I also use the hicariCP data source, the configuration read and write separation starts normally, the test is normal, once the configuration data is desensitized, this problem occurs.

Hi, @beijing-penguin Appreciated your contribution. The point need to discuss i think is that can we use `jdbc interface` to get `url` and `username`? Therefore we will not care about which connection pool user chooses. When get connection for `jdbc url`, `username` can be got as well. Do you think it is available？

> I read the pgsql、mysql and oracle jdbc source code，about catalog and schema method parameter，the result is :
> 1、All database's catalog equal database name
> 2、oracle's schema equal username ,but other database's schema equal null.

It is great. Your detail investigation inspired us how to solve this issue! Thanks a lot @beijing-penguin

The problem has reproduced, Thanks your reply.

The bug will fixed with #3187 .

The reason may be in EncryptRuntimeContext.getColumnMetaDataList() line 95
 
```
boolean isAutoIncrement = resultSet.getBoolean(IS_AUTOINCREMENT);
```

From the exception, mysql may return the result 'NO', but we use getBoolean in there, so it can't be translate to boolean.

i have solved this problem
in my pom.xml

```xml
                <exclusion>
                    <artifactId>jaxb-api</artifactId>
                    <groupId>javax.xml.bind</groupId>
                </exclusion>
                <exclusion>
                    <artifactId>jaxb-core</artifactId>
                    <groupId>com.sun.xml.bind</groupId>
                </exclusion>
                <exclusion>
                    <artifactId>jaxb-impl</artifactId>
                    <groupId>com.sun.xml.bind</groupId>
                </exclusion>
```

i exclude xml related dependencies and i add 

```xml
        <dependency>
            <groupId>xerces</groupId>
            <artifactId>xercesImpl</artifactId>
            <version>2.11.0</version>
        </dependency>
```

@mygitdds , I remember that you have premised this problem #3388 .

The problem is you do not put the saga.properties into your root class path.
For springboot jar model, you can package a `conf` dir, and put all of the properties into there.

Then you put the `conf` dir into your root class path like `-classpath .:${yourClassPath}:${parentPath}/conf/* `
